column1: 2 ^ Deus
column2: auribus nostrīs audīvimus; patrēs nostrī adnuntiāvērunt nōbīs
column3: opus quod operātus es in diēbus eōrum
column4: et in diēbus antīquīs. ^ O God
column5: we have heard with our ears; our fathers have declared to us
column6: the work thou hast wrought in their days
column7: and in the days of old.

column1: 3 ^ Manus tua gentēs disperdidit
column2: et plantāstī eōs; afflīxistī populōs
column3: et expulistī eōs; ^ Thy hand destroyed the Gentiles
column4: and thou plantedst them; thou didst afflict the people

column1: 4 ^ nec enim in gladiō suō possēdērunt terram
column2: et bracchium eōrum nōn salvāvit eōs; sed dextera tua et bracchium tuum
column4: quoniam complacuistī in eīs. ^ for not by their own sword did they inherit the land
column5: and their own arm did not save them; rather thy right hand and thy arm
column6: and the light of thy countenance
column7: because thou wast pleased with them.

column1: 5 ^ Tū es ipse rēx meus et Deus meus
column2: quī mandās salūtēs Jācōbī. ^ Thou art thyself my king and my God
column3: who commandest the saving for Jacob.

column1: 6 ^ In tē inimīcōs nostrōs ventilābimus cornū
column2: et in nōmine tuō spernēmus insurgentēs in nōbīs. ^ Through thee we will push down our enemies with the horn
column3: and through thy name we will despise them that rise up against us.

column1: 7 ^ Nōn enim in arcū meō spērābō
column2: et gladius meus nōn salvābit mē. ^ For I will not trust in my bow
column3: and my sword shall not save me.

column1: 8 ^ Salvāstī enim nōs dē afflīgentibus nōs
column2: et odientēs nōs confūdistī. ^ But thou hast saved us from them that afflict us
column3: and hast put them to shame that hate us.

column1: 9 ^ In Deō laudābimur tōtā diē
column2: et in nōmine tuō confitēbimur in saeculum. ^ In God shall we glory all the day long
column3: and in thy name we will give praise for ever.

column1: 10 ^ Nunc autem repulistī et confūdistī nōs
column2: et nōn ēgrediēris
column4: in virtūtibus nostrīs. ^ But now thou hast cast us off
column8: wilt not go out with our armies.

column1: 11 ^ Āvertistī nōs retrōrsum post inimīcōs nostrōs
column2: et quī ōdērunt nōs
column3: dīripiēbant sibi. ^ Thou hast made us turn our back to our enemies
column4: and they that hated us plundered for themselves.

column1: 12 ^ Dedistī nōs tamquam ovēs ēscārum
column2: et in Gentibus dispersistī nōs. ^ Thou hast given us up like sheep to be eaten
column3: and thou hast scattered us among the nations.

column1: 13 ^ Vendidistī populum tuum sine pretiō
column2: et nōn fuit multitūdō in commūtātiōnibus eōrum. ^ Thou hast sold thy people for no price
column3: and there was no reckoning in the exchange of them.

column1: 14 ^ Posuistī nōs opprobrium vīcīnīs nostrīs; subsannātiōnem et dērīsum hīs quī sunt in circumitū nostrō. ^ Thou hast made us a reproach to our neighbours; a scoff and derision to them that are round about us.
15 ^ Posuistī nōs in similitūdinem Gentibus; commōtiōnem capitis in populīs. ^ Thou hast made us a byword among the Gentiles; a shaking of the head among the people.
16 ^ Tōtā diē verēcundia mea contrā mē est
column2: et confūsiō faciēī meae cooperuit mē
column3: ^ All the day long my shame is before me
column4: and the confusion of my face hath covered me

column1: 17 ^ ā vōce exprōbrantis et obloquentis
column2: ā faciē inimīcī et persequentis. ^ at the voice of him that reproacheth and detracteth me; at the face of the enemy and persecutor.

column1: 18 ^ Haec omnia vēnērunt super nōs
column2: nec oblītī sumus tē
column3: et inīquē nōn ēgimus in testāmentō tuō. ^ All these things have come upon us
column4: yet we have not forgotten thee
column5: and we have not done wickedly in thy covenant.

column1: 19 ^ Et nōn recessit retrō cor nostrum
column2: et dēclīnāstī sēmitās nostrās ā viā tuā
column3: ^ And our heart hath not turned back
column4: and thou hast diverted our steps from thy way

column1: 20 ^ quoniam humiliāstī nōs in locō afflīctiōnis
column2: et cooperuit nōs umbra mortis. ^ for thou hast humbled us in the place of affliction
column3: and the shadow of death hath covered us.

column1: 21 ^ Sī oblītī sumus nōmen Deī nostrī
column2: et sī expandimus manūs nostrās ad deum aliēnum
column3: ^ If we have forgotten the name of our God
column4: and if we have spread forth our hands to a strange god

column1: 22 ^ nōnne Deus requīret ista? Ipse enim nōvit abscondita cordis. Quoniam propter tē mortificāmur tōtā diē; aestimātī sumus sīcut ovēs occīsiōnis. ^ shall not God search out these things? For he knoweth the secrets of the heart. Because for thy sake we are killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
23 ^ Exsurge
column2: quārē obdormīs
column4: et nē repellās in fīnem. ^ Arise
column7: and cast us not off to the end.

column1: 24 ^ Quārē faciem tuam āvertis? Oblīvīsceris inopiae nostrae et trībulātiōnis nostrae? ^ Why turnest thou thy face away? Why forgettest our want and our trouble?
25 ^ Quoniam humiliāta est in pulvere anima nostra; conglūtinātus est in terrā venter noster. ^ For our soul is humbled down to the dust; our belly cleaveth to the earth.
26 ^ Exsurge
column2: Domine
column4: et redime nōs propter nōmen tuum. ^ Arise
column7: and redeem us for thy name's sake.
